page.title: 13A NEW INFANT SCHOOL, GRAYS
page.content: The new{THAMESIDE INFANT SCHOOL}has been built on Thameside Juniors' running track. The old infant school used to be in Arthur Street. It was opened on June 4th 1888. 97 years later, on Thursday the 6th of June 1985, the Juniors greeted the Infants parading into their new school, which is now in Manor Road. Unfortunately it was drizzling with rain, but that did not stop the spirit of the infants marching to their new Manor Road school. There were teachers, mothers and children marching. The infants played musical instruments and carried banners. Before they went into their school a small ceremony was held. A school governor smashed a bottle of champagne on the wall of the new school. Everyone went inside the building to begin a new era of education in South Grays.
